author: Chris Eckeard
comment: The app is broken on my Moto 360 Sport. The buttons are unresponsive and there appears to be a secondary digit display overlaying the top buttons. Uninstalling and reinstalling did not fix the issue.

author: John L. Stanley
comment: Over 10 months ago you said you'd release a version that would work on a Smarwatch 3.  What's the problem?  The picture in the store of the square layout looks Great.  Please let us use it...
title: Still doesn't work right on SW3

author: John Tevis
comment: It does not work on my LG watch. Please fix as I would love to have a calculator like this on my watch. If it helps, there looks to be a screen in front of the f & g keys and now buttons work.

author: Tyrone Blackburn
comment: I was so afraid that I'd be stuck with some generic standard calculator on my LG G Watch R.  This does the job and is consistent with the HP calculators we all know and love.  Well done.
title: Excellent Implemenation

author: Christian Schroeder
comment: I'll give it a 3, in order to be neutral. Just wanted to let you know that it isn't compatible on the huawei watch.
title: Doesn't work on the huawei watch

author: Kevin Flathers
comment: Don't promise and show a square screen, but not have it implemented, nor an update out that puts it into motion. Don't lie to your customers. Last updated 1/19/2015
title: Don't promise and never deliver

author: Bret Hicks
comment: Just tried this on my Moto 360 and had a really hard time accurately pressing the buttons. Also, the input method does not reflect a standard calculator. e.g. Press 6, press X, press 5, press enter/equals for the result. This app seems to want the following,  press 6, press enter, press 5, press X. Why? No calculator I have ever used operated like that, from super cheap desk models to very complex graphing calculators. This makes no sense to me.

reply.author: Keesoft Apps
reply.content: It's a RPN type calculator. That's how they work. The ENTER key is a number separator, not the equal key. There isn't an equal key or parentheses. They are not needed. All operations are executed immediately. To calculate (5+4)x(6-3) press 5,ENTER,4,+,6,ENTER,3,-,x gives 27. There will be a RPN tutorial in the next version. Sorry for the confusion.

title: Doesn't seem to work well.

author: Brian Scott Oplinger
comment: Sure its tiny, its on my watch. But its great. Way more useful than the standard 4 function + memory that's offered in other wear calcs. Looks good on my LG G watch and I find the keys usable.
title: Tiny but great

author: Stephen Snider
comment: I can't get this to switch to the square face on my Sony smartwatch3. I'd love to be able to use it more fully.

reply.author: Keesoft Apps
reply.content: Right now RPN Calculator only works on the Moto 360, LG G, and LG G Watch R. I'll soon be offering a version that will work with the Sony SmartWatch 3. Sorry for the inconvenience.

title: Cool idea but doesn't square for smartwatch3

author: Quinn Morley
comment: Calculator is not functional on my Motorola 360 2. Drawing error and unresponsive.
title: Not working on 360 2.

author: Markus Birth
comment: 1 year after promising to make it detect Sony SWR50, it's still showing up round on it.

author: Nick Tedesco
comment: The screen for the calculator covers numbers 5 through 9, can't see the function of these keys. Using a moto 360 with galaxy note 2

reply.author: Keesoft Apps
reply.content: Thanks for your report Nick. It's fixed now.

author: Ed DeQuasie
comment: I wanted to love this calculator. I love RPN calculators and my trusty 12c. Unfortunately, the buttons on this calculator are very difficult to hit on Moto 360. The display in the middle feels awkward, too. For a larger display, it's probably fine, but I guess I'll have to use a different app.
title: Love RPN - hate tiny buttons

author: Jeff Miles
comment: I am a long time RPN fan and was looking forward to an RPN calculator on my Moto 360. This calculator looks great. But, it is laggy and the buttons are not easy to press. It is hard enough to hit buttons on such a small screen. But this calculator makes it harder than it ought to be. Too bad. Had great hopes for this one.
title: Looks great, but not easy to use

author: Andy Hong
comment: On my Gear Live, this app remains in a round layout (designed for the Moto 360). The buttons are so tiny that they're impossible to touch reliably. But for many months, this was the only RPN app I could find for Android Wear, so I continued to use it for "lightweight" calculations, despite the app's limitations. Recently, I discovered RetroCalc, an RPN app that displays correctly on my square Gear Live and has much bigger buttons. So I'm now a RetroCalc user. But I do miss RPN Calculator's better use of colors and contrasts. The smaller buttons in RPN Calculator are actually easier to read than the bigger buttons in RetroCalc!
